channel.title: Hugo 101 on Abdelrahman Ahmad
channel.description: Recent content in Hugo 101 on Abdelrahman Ahmad

item.title: About
item.description: Personal Info I’m Abdelrahman and I’m an IoT researcher at Pro2Future GmbH. I come from Egypt but I live in Linz-Austria now. I got my bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from the German University in Cairo in 2016, then I joined Johannes Kepler University for my master’s degree. I finished my master’s in summer 2017 and after that applied for PhD which is still pending üòâ Languages Arabic (Mother Tongue) English German (B1) Arduino, Python, Java, MySQL, Git — ‚≠ê ‚≠ê ‚≠ê ‚≠ê C++, LaTeX, HTML, CSS — ‚≠ê ‚≠ê ‚≠ê C, PHP, C#, Android, JavaScript — ‚≠ê ‚≠ê

item.title: Education
item.description: Jan. 2019 - Present PhD student in Technical Sciences: Computer Science, from Johannes Kepler University in Linz-Austria Sep. 2017 - July 2018 Master‚Äôs of Science: Informatics:- Engineering Management, from Johannes Kepler University in Linz-Austria Sep. 2012 - July 2017 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Media and Engineering Technology: Computer Science, from the German University in Cairo-Egypt

item.title: Internships
item.description: Jun. 2016 - Aug. 2016 Gaitech Technology Company in Shanghai-China Building the company‚Äôs Educational website for Turtlebot robot and Drones. Developing new tutorials for the Turtlebot robot. May 2015 - Aug. 2015 Prince Sultan University in Riyadh-KSA Integrating ROS Hydro and ROS Indigo versions with Arduino Developing an application to control a Turtlebot Arm with an Arduino Ultrasonic Sensor Developing an application to control a Turtlebot Arm with an Arduino RFID Investigating the integration of the Turtlebot arm with moveit!

item.title: Research & Publications
item.description: Research Oct. 2017 - July 2018 Master thesis entitled: ‚ÄùA Smart Network for Marketing Solutions‚Äù, a model of a smart network is established using different IoT devices connected to different sensors and communicating through a wired network creating a bus system to handle communication between smart devices and a main server. A prototype was successfully deployed with the Umdasch Digital Retail company. The smart device that was used is a Raspberry Pi 3 (model B) programmed in Python connected to different sensors.
